title: Reforming Nuclear Reactor Testing at the Department of Energy

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Department of Energy to speed up the testing, approval, and deployment of advanced nuclear reactors to boost innovation and domestic production. It also establishes a pilot program to construct reactors outside national labs and streamlines environmental review processes to meet operational goals by mid-2026.
potential_concerns: The expedited approval and streamlined environmental reviews could compromise thorough safety and environmental assessments, disproportionately impacting environmental-justice-communities near reactor sites.
Rapid deployment schedules may pressure scientific researchers and technology workers to prioritize speed over comprehensive testing, potentially increasing technical risks.
Pilot programs for reactors outside national laboratories may face resistance or implementation challenges in rural communities where many sites may be located.
Defense industry workers may benefit from innovation and deployment of advanced reactors, but increased focus on defense applications could divert resources from civilian energy needs.
